Class BidirectionalLinkedList<E>

  • java.lang.Object
    • BidirectionalLinkedList<E>

  • public class BidirectionalLinkedList<E>
extends java.lang.Object
    This class defines the Linked-List data-struceture that supports bi-directional, cyclic flow of control. __________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________ | cell2 cell1 cell2 cell3 cell1 cell2 \ | / ____|________________________ _________________________________ __________________________\ /_ | | | | |<-----------o | | |<--------............---------------------o | | | cell1 | o | Object o | o-------->| | Object o | o------ .... total of n elements -------->| | Object o | o | <-- UnidirectionalLinkedListElement |________|____________|_______| |___________|___________|________| in the list |__________|__________|___|___| index0 ^ index1 index(n - 1) | / \ | |_________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________| The elements in such an instance of this class are linked together the way it has been graphically depicted above. Just like most other data-structures, the indexing begins from 0.
    Since:
    1.0.1

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      BidirectionalLinkedList()
      The no-arg constructor to create an empty list.
      BidirectionalLinkedList(E o)
      This constructor creates a new list with only one element that is being passed as argument.

      • getElement

        public E getElement(int index)
             throws ListIndexOutOfBoundsException
        Parameters:
        index - the index of the element to be retrieved.
        Returns:
        the entry contained at the element at the specified index.
        Throws:
        ListIndexOutOfBoundsException

      • get

        public BidirectionalLinkedList.BidirectionalLinkedListElement<E> get(int index)
                                                              throws ListIndexOutOfBoundsException
        Parameters:
        index - the index of the UnidirectionalLinkedListElement to be retrieved.
        Returns:
        the UnidirectionalLinkedListElement at the specified index. We must rememeber here that UnidirectionalLinkedListElement has private access and thus none of its methods except toString() can be accessed outside this class. If you want to get the entry E at the specifiedIndex, use getElement(int) method instead.
        Throws:
        ListIndexOutOfBoundsException

      • add

        public void add(E o)
        This method adds an element at the end of the list.
        Parameters:
        o - the entry to be added to the new element.

      • add

        public void add(E o,
                int index)
         throws ListIndexOutOfBoundsException
        This method adds a new element in the MIDDLE(not the end) of the list such that the new element has = index
        Parameters:
        index - the index value of the new element.
        o - entry to be contained in the new element
        Throws:
        ListIndexOutOfBoundsException

      • remove

        public void remove(int index)

      • setEntry

        public void setEntry(E o,
                     int index)
        This method updates the entry in the element at index and sets it to the passed argument.

        index - the index of the element to be updated

      • prev

        public BidirectionalLinkedList.BidirectionalLinkedListElement<E> prev()
